Sentence.sentence: Some communities have agreed to share online—geneticists, for example, post DNA sequences at the GenBank repository ( ' , 库), and astronomers are accustomed to accessing images of galaxies and stars from, say, the Sloan Digital Sky Survey, a telescope that has observed some 500 million objects—but these remain the exception, not the rule.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In the author's view, being equipped with IT products may help colleges and universities build an innovative image.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The result could be a group of young people that, like their boomer (二战后生育高峰期出生的美国人) parents, grows up with a strong sense of purpose and sheds the image of apathy (冷漠) they've inherited from Generation X (60 .代后期和70 .代出生的美国人).
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Imaging how you both feel if she fixed the turkey dinner or something.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: For example, there is the image of the bridge into the sea taken at the Normandy D-Day landing site.
Sentence.come: 2017年6月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: Research conducted at Stanford University shows a mental image fires the nerve system the same way as actually doing something.
Sentence.come: 2017年6月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section B

Sentence.sentence: That means when a golfer tells himself "Don't hit the ball into the water", his mind sees the image of the ball flying into the water.
Sentence.come: 2017年6月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section B

Sentence.sentence: The image which also contained novel descriptions of ants, fascinated a European audience that was more concerned with the exotic story unfolding before them than the gender of the person who painted it.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: This boosts the reputation and image of Adidas by making people more aware of the company's values.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: But the next step is making sure that you remember what you've read!  You may have just read the text, but the ideas, concepts and images (形象) may fly right out of your head.

Sentence.sentence: By the time they started secondary school—at age 11—children were already far more aware of their image online and felt under huge pressure to ensure their posts were popular, the report found.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: China's image is improving steadily, with more countries recognizing its role in international affairs.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语江苏卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Frank Hurley, a confident and gifted Australian photographer who knew the antArctic, was hired to make the images, most of which have never before been published.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: From family pets and wild animals to toys, stuffed animal , and media images, animals are a central part of every child's world.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（6月） 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: From the moment a child is born, they interact with the world, looking at colours, feeding textures; constructing mental and physical images of what they see and experience.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（6月） 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Many of the images were stored in an ice chest, under freezing water, in the damaged wooden ship.

Sentence.sentence: Some change their behaviour in real life to improve their image on the web.

Sentence.sentence: These demands must also be balanced with the need to create interiorsthat in some way enhance, establish, or promote a companies image.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 选词填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: While watching TV, children do not merely absorb words and images.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语广东卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: You should also list the software you use to edit any images.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖南卷 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: The magazine cover showing an attractive mother holding a cute baby is hardly the only Madonna-and-child image on newsstands this week.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Of course, the image of parenthood that celebrity magazines like Us Weekly and People present is hugely unrealistic, especially when the parents are single mothers like Bullock.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But it’s interesting to wonder if the images we see every week of stress-free, happiness-enhancing parenthood aren’t in some small, subconscious way contributing to our own dissatisfactions with the actual experience, in the same way that a small part of us hoped getting “ the Rachel” might make us look just a little bit like Jennifer Aniston.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In effect, you try to reconstruct the likely meanings or effects that any given sentence, image or reference might have had: These might be the ones the author intended.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Even so, these are wealthy families who party with the international 1%, and media intrusiveness makes it increasingly difficult to maintain the right image.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Plus, whatever image we present is magnified by social-media services like LinkedIn.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In Denmark, the United States, and a few other countries, it is trying to set voluntary standards for models and fashion images that rely more on peer pressure for enforcement.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Create a new image of yourself.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: As an executive coach, I’ve seen image upgrades be particularly helpful during transitions---when looking for a new job, stepping into a new or more public role, or changing work environments.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Are you looking to refresh your image or pivot it? For one person, the goal may be to be taken more seriously and enhance their professional image.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Rested in the Pacific Ocean, Mauna Kea’s peak rises above the bulk of our planet’s dense atmosphere, where conditions allow telescopes to obtain images of unsurpassed clarity.

means.word_mean: 镜像, 影像, 图像, 雕像

sentences.en: She looked at her image in the mirror.
sentences.cn: 她看着镜子中自己的映像。

sentences.en: I have this image of you as always being cheerful and optimistic.
sentences.cn: 你留给我的印象总是快活和乐观。

sentences.en: She was the spitting image of her mother.
sentences.cn: 她和她母亲长得一模一样。

means.word_mean: 比喻, 引喻, 明喻

sentences.en: The writer used the image of corn silk to describe the girl's hair.
sentences.cn: 作者用玉米须来比喻那女孩的头发。

means.word_mean: 外形, 外表, 模样</seg>

sentence.cn: 精心设计的办公空间有助于塑造公司形象。
sentence.en: Well-designed office spaces help create a corporation's image.
sentence.from: 2015年高考英语上海卷 选词填空 原文

entry.def: If you have an image of something or someone, you have a picture or idea of them in your mind.

example.ex: The image of art theft as a gentleman's crime is outdated...
example.tran: 把盗窃艺术品看作是一种绅士犯罪的观念已经过时了。

example.ex: The words 'Cote d'Azur' conjure up images of sunny days in Mediterranean cafes.
example.tran: Cote d'Azur (蓝色海岸)这个词让人联想到地中海咖啡馆阳光明媚的日子。

entry.def: The image of a person, group, or organization is the way that they appear to other people.
entry.tran: (个人、团队或组织的)形象,声誉

example.ex: The Prime Minister knows that his personal image is his greatest political asset...
example.tran: 总理知道他的个人形象是他最重要的政治资产。

example.ex: He has cultivated the image of an elder statesman...
example.tran: 他已树立起一个政界元老的形象。

entry.def: An image is a picture of someone or something.

example.ex: A computer in the machine creates an image on the screen.
example.tran: 机器上的计算机在屏幕上产生了影像。

entry.def: An image is a poetic description of something.
entry.tran: 诗意的描绘;生动的描绘

example.ex: The natural images in the poem are meant to be suggestive of realities beyond themselves.
example.tran: 诗中描绘的自然景象意在让人联想到景象以外的现实。

entry.def: If you are the image of someone else, you look very much like them.

example.ex: Marianne's son was the image of his father.
example.tran: 玛丽安娜的儿子长得酷似他父亲。

sentences.sentence: "her imagination forced images upon her too awful to contemplate"

means.word_mean: 2. a visual representation (of an object or scene or person or abstraction) produced on a surface;

sentences.sentence: "they showed us the pictures of their wedding"
"a movie is a series of images projected so rapidly that the eye integrates them"

means.word_mean: 3. (Jungian psychology) a personal facade that one presents to the world;

sentences.sentence: "a public image is as fragile as Humpty Dumpty"
"he is the prototype of good breeding"
"he provided America with an image of the good father"

means.word_mean: 5. language used in a figurative or nonliteral sense
6. someone who closely resembles a famous person (especially an actor);

sentences.sentence: "she's the very image of her mother"

means.word_mean: 7. a representation of a person (especially in the form of sculpture);

sentences.sentence: "the coin bears an effigy of Lincoln"
"the emperor's tomb had his image carved in stone"

means.word_mean: 1. imagine; conceive of; see in one's mind;

sentences.sentence: "I can see a risk in this strategy"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French, from Latin imago; related to imitate

sentences.en: Nonetheless, the material imagination remains grounded in primitive images of hardness and softness.

sentences.cn: 你能想像那有多恐怖 吗 ?
sentences.en: Can you imaging how horrible it is?

sentences.cn: 现代人的鲜明形象中又穿插了梦境的自由变化和怪诞的象征语言.
sentences.en: The uninhibited mutations and grotesque symbolic language of dreams interrupt the distinct images of contemporary humanity.

sentences.cn: 在文学作品中, 象征是以象征意象来暗示表现抽象的意义.
sentences.en: In literary works, symbol is used to hint abstract meanings by way of symbolic images.

sentences.cn: 至今罗马建筑在西方世界仍是代表权利与秩序的象征.
sentences.en: And Roman architecture is still the image of power and order throughout the Western world today.

sentences.cn: 这些影像是关于中国社会现实图景的象征主义的隐语.
sentences.en: These images are symbolistic argots about realistic prospect of Chinese society.

sentences.cn: 希尼歌剧院当然是最能代表当今世界的象征之一了.
sentences.en: Sydney Opera House must be one of the most recognizable images of the modern world.

sentences.cn: 红色是让人兴奋的颜色, 它象征着动感, 力量和危险.
sentences.en: Red is an exciting colour. It creates an image of action, energy and danger.

sentences.cn: 名牌是企业形象和信誉的象征.
sentences.en: Corporate image and name is a symbol of credibility.

sentences.cn: 所以和达达艺术一样, 他首先驱除的是艺术图像中的象征主义因素.
sentences.en: Therefore, like Dadaist artists , he started by ridding the art images off their symbolic elements.

sentences.cn: 而且在全世界看来, 他也成为美国文化的主要象征.
sentences.en: And throughout the world, he is often the central image of American culture.

sentences.cn: 一个象征是一个有着深度意义的心像.
sentences.en: C. A symbol is an image that has a deeper meaning.

sentences.cn: 一些主要的意象反复地出现、重新组合, 构成了一个相对稳定的象征的体系.
sentences.en: Some of the major images occur and recombine constantly, forming into a relatively steady symbolic system.

sentences.cn: 所有广告都应该有助于建立一个复杂的象征符号,即品牌形象.
sentences.en: Every advertisement must contribute to the complex symbol which is the brand image.

sentences.cn: 镜像的虚无性、象征性催生着人的一切欲望.
sentences.en: The nothingness and the symbolic quality of mirror image motivate the subjects desires.

sentences.cn: 在西方文学传统中, 荒原意象是重要的精神象征形式.
sentences.en: In Western literary tradition, wasteland image is an important format of spiritual symbol.

sentences.cn: 面对落日象征的生命的短促与飞逝,建安诗人充实有限,两晋诗人企慕无限,宋代诗人融无限于有限之中.
sentences.en: The setting sun images symbolized short and quickly passing life.

Sentence.sentence: From this perspective, people are born essentially like undeveloped photographs: The image is already captured, but the way it eventually appears can vary based on the development process.

Sentence.sentence: As one of the most brutal predators (食肉动物), killer whales may not fit the image of a cultured creature.

Sentence.sentence: The white clothing conveyed an image of cleanliness, according to Careme—and in his realm, appearance was everything.

Sentence.sentence: They project the image of confidence, and perhaps most importantly, they know when to stop.
